text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with garlic parmesan croutons
that's right we're making our own
croutons and I don't mind store-bought
croutons if it wasn't for the you know
exorbitant price artificial ingredients
and high sodium content they'd be
perfect by the way for best results you
should make this wearing a white v-neck
t-shirt with some chest hair showing
first we're gonna do some garlic oil
we're going to take 1/2 cup of olive oil
and four cloves are very very crushed or
really finely minced garlic let that
infuse for a few hours out at room
temperature you really want that to be
intensely garlic then we're going to
take one loaf of French bread baguette
which is 8 ounces I'm going to cut it in
half and then in half and then in
quarters cut it in cubes about the same
size by the way
do as I say not as I wish I did use
day-old baguette this is totally fresh
and it just doesn't work as good because
it's not as absorbent throw that in a
mixing bowl then we're going to take
that garlic infused oil strain it over
the bread make sure you press out all
the goodness with the back of a spoon
take a spatula and toss that really well
alright once the bread is completely
coated with the oil we're going to dump
in half a cup of finely grated real
Parmesan cheese
none of that stuff from the green
canister please alright we're also going
to put in some freshly ground black
pepper
alright a pinch of salt maybe about a
half a teaspoon which I don't even think
you saw that going a little shake of
cayenne and/or paprika so if you like it
spicy use cayenne and then a big pinch
about a half a teaspoon - a quarter
teaspoon of dry Italian herbs give that
a toss and then we're going to put that
out on a baking sheet make sure they're
all spread out nice and even single
layer okay you don't want them on top of
each other you want a single layer all
the single ladies all the single layers
all single layers call the single layers
that's pretty catchy I wonder if people
will do like parody videos of this now
we're going to put that in a 300 degree
oven and let it go for 15 minutes then
give them a toss now again do as I say
now as I did take them out of the oven
close the oven toss and put them back
in the oven because you know you lose
all your heat alright put those back in
for about 15 more minutes alright so 15
minutes later take them out they're not
going to be cooked yet but they're going
to be getting close
I'm going to push them together with the
spatula kinda so that they're touching
because I'm going to sprinkle over
another quarter cup of Parmesan cheese
and these are going to go back in until
crispy crunchy and delicious so it might
take 10 15 20 minutes more it depends so
what you want to do is just play that by
ear so just don't burn them and just
don't undercook them somewhere in
between would be perfect so there you go
garlic parmesan croutons those are just
waiting to go into some Caesar salad one
huge tip here do not put these away in a
container until they're completely cold
otherwise they will get really soggy
like some popcorn ahead recently that's
a little inside joke for a good friend
of mine anyway I hope give those a try
all the ingredients are on the site and
as always enjoy
